title: Collective licensing: extending the benefits

details.body:
Consultation inviting views on the legal effectiveness, structure and effect of the proposed draft Copyright (Extended Collective Licensing) Regulations.

Extended Collective Licensing (ECL) is one of the measures government is introducing to simplify the licensing system. Along with several other measures in the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013, it will help make copyright licensing more efficient and remove unnecessary barriers to the legitimate use of works, while preserving the interests of right holders.

It is for all interested parties across all sectors, including:

  • collecting societies
  • authors and creators
  • users of collective licences

government.title: 2010 to 2015 Conservative and Liberal Democrat coalition government
